attributes.action: ignore European Union (EU) rules regarding restriction of Olympic ticket sales
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The EU has imposed rules upon the Olympic Organising Committee, saying that tickes may not be sold to British Citizens first, and may not be sold before becoming available to the rest of the EU.

This is wholely unfair as the British taxpayer has funded the olympics out of their own pocket. We feel that the least we are owed is a fair chance of a ticket to the Olympic venues in 2012.

As the govt now defends the rights and interests of the Falklands Islanders (whatever you may think of the issue), can it not also defend the rights and interests of the UK citizens?

It just takes one word: No.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the London Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympic Games (LOCOG)
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
